column1: Arcadia is a city in Los Angeles County
column4: located about 13 miles (21 km) northeast of downtown Los Angeles in the San Gabriel Valley and at the base of the San Gabriel Mountains. It is the site of the Santa Anita Park racetrack and home to the Los Angeles County Arboretum and Botanic Garden. The city had a population of 56

column2: 000 years the site of Arcadia was part of the homeland of the Tongva people ("Gabrieliño" tribe)
column3: a Californian Native American tribe whose territory spanned the greater Los Angeles Basin
column4: and the San Gabriel and San Fernando Valleys. Their fluid borders stretched between: the Santa Susana Mountains
column6: and San Gabriel Mountains in the north; the Santa Monica Mountains and Simi Hills in the west; the San Jacinto Mountains and Santa Ana Mountains in the east; and the coast and Catalina Island (Pimu) in the south. A Tongva settlement site within present-day Arcadia was known as Alyeupkigna (or Aluupkenga).

column2: Arcadia was home to the U.S. Army's Ross Field Balloon School

column2: Arcadia's population grew and local businesses included many chicken ranches and other agricultural activities. During the 1920s and 1930s
column3: Arcadia began its transition to the residential city that it is today
column4: as small farms and chicken ranches gave way to homes and numerous civic improvements
column5: including a city library and a city hall. Scenes of many of Arcadia's interesting older sites can be viewed in a series of historic watercolors painted by local artists Edna Lenz and Justine Wishek. The city was on historic U.S. Route 66 in California

column1: Thoroughbred horse racing had flourished briefly under Lucky Baldwin
column2: who founded a racetrack adjacent to the present site
column3: until it was outlawed by the state of California in 1909. It returned to Arcadia when racing was legalized again
column4: with the opening of Santa Anita Park in December 1934. Architect Gordon Kaufmann designed its various buildings in a combination of Colonial Revival and Streamline Moderne styles.

column1: The Santa Anita Assembly Center site is California Historical Landmark #934. In 1942 during World War II
column2: the racetrack grounds were used as a processing and holding site for Japanese Americans who had been removed from their homes and communities for forced relocation and internment under President Franklin Roosevelt's Executive Order 9066. The Civilian Assembly Center at the racetrack became the largest and longest operating one of the eighteen
column3: holding citizens until the Relocation Center camps were completed in interior areas of California and other states. More than 18
column4: 000 persons resided at the racetrack in primitive conditions. Four hundred temporary tarpaper barracks were constructed on the racetrack grounds to house many of the detainees
column5: where they lived three families per unit. 8
column6: 500 detainees lived in converted horse stalls. Bachelors were housed in the grandstand building. They had group showers
column7: non-private bathrooms
column8: and 24-hour armed surveillance. Each resident was given an "Army manufacture bed
column9: one blanket and one straw tick." The Assembly Center held people from late March through the end of October 1942
column10: when the internees were relocated inland to permanent internment camps at Manzanar and Tule Lake in California
column11: and eight others in Western states and Arkansas.

column2: Arcadia's civic leaders were very vocal in their support of the Japanese American relocation internment policies of the federal government.In November 1942 the center was turned over to the U.S. Army Ordnance Corps for training purposes and was officially renamed Camp Santa Anita. Later in the war it served as a prisoner of war—POW camp
column3: holding several thousand of Rommel's German Afrika Korps soldiers.

column1: The Los Angeles County Arboretum and Botanic Garden is located in Arcadia across from the Santa Anita mall and racetrack. The peafowl that roam free on the grounds and in the neighborhoods near the arboretum are a remainder of the former Baldwin ranch. When the peafowl were brought from India
column2: they helped control snakes and snails on his farm. They are considered an attraction to some residents and a nuisance to others due to their loud cries and the droppings they leave on residents' properties.

column1: Arcadia is a charter city governed by a five-member City Council (which also serves as the city's Redevelopment Agency)
column2: with each member serving a four-year term. The Council elects from its membership a Mayor to serve as its presiding officer for a one-year term.
Arcadia voters elect a City Council member by geographical district instead of at-large.

column1: For primary and secondary education the city is served by the Arcadia Unified School District. Reading scores for the AUSD are 76.6% higher than the state average and math scores are 67.9% higher than the state average. It is estimated that 88% of Arcadia students are at public schools and 12% in private and/or parochial institutions.
Arcadia Unified School District has one highly ranked and prestigious high school
column2: Arcadia High School. It is among the few public high schools in California to receive a distinguished GreatSchools Rating of 10 out of 10. There are three middle schools
column4: two which are winners in the United States Department of Education's Blue Ribbon Schools program. Approximately five percent of California schools are awarded this honor each year following a rigorous selection process. Eligibility is based on federal and state criteria including the No Child Left Behind program
column6: and Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP). The requirements are many and strict
column7: and are based on such areas as a strong curriculum
column10: and counseling programs at all grade levels. In 2010
column11: BusinessWeek ranked Arcadia as the best place to raise children in the state of California for the second year in a row
column12: citing the city's excellent school system as one of the factors in addition to the low crime rate.
